channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: From friction to flow: Why Swissport scrapped its VPN maze for Cato’s SASE fabric
item.description: Swissport ditches legacy tech, deploying a global, Zero Trust SASE architecture with Cato Networks securing 26,000 users, unlocking real-time control.

item.title: Are tariffs worth the risk to our retirement — and overall — economic security?
item.description: Raucous debate clarified the national defense case for strategic tariffs, but it’s hard to argue for a worldwide tariff war

item.title: OpenAI makes ChatGPT’s image generation available as API
item.description: Enterprises can now make Studio Ghibli-inspired images through OpenAI's API.

item.title: More accurate coding: Researchers adapt Sequential Monte Carlo for AI-generated code
item.description: Researchers from MIT, Yale, McGill University and others found that adapting the Sequential Monte Carlo algorithm can make AI-generated code better.

item.title: ‘I find it ridiculous’: My friend cleaned out her father’s bank account. Should I intervene?
item.description: “Before you accuse me of being pea green with envy, I have more savings, own properties, and have all my debts paid.”

item.title: Fed Beige Book says ‘pervasive’ uncertainty from trade fights depresses outlook for economy
item.description: Economy gets short-term boost from buyers trying to avoid tariffs
